summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued to Ghislaine Maxwell by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding her to appear and testify on July 24, 2019, regarding alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy statutes. The subpoena includes an attached 'Advice of Rights' and a request to preserve confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The document is a grand jury subpoena directly addressed to Ghislaine Maxwell, commanding her to appear and testify before the grand jury in connection with an investigation into alleged federal sex trafficking and related offenses.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Geoffrey S. Berman is listed as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the grand jury subpoena to Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a grand jury subpoena to Maxwell, compelling her testimony in a federal criminal investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Subpoena
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury for the Southern District of New York at 10:00 a.m. to testify and give evidence regarding alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy laws.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office to Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
The Silvio J. Mao Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was subpoenaed to testify before a federal grand jury on July 24, 2019, in the Southern District of New York.

The investigation involved alleged violations of federal statutes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421-2423 (transportation for prostitution, coercion, and minors), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested Maxwell voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The subpoena included an 'Advice of Rights' informing Maxwell of her right against self-incrimination and right to counsel.
The document indicates an active federal criminal investigation into sex trafficking and related offenses was underway as of July 2019.
